git.title: Set your details
git.command:
git config --global user.name "Mark Pnsit"
git config --global user.email "Mark@example.com"
git.description: Use --global to set the configuration for all projects. If git config is used without --global and run inside a project directory, the settings are set for the specific project.

git.title: Make git ignore file modes
git.command:
cd project/
git config core.filemode false
git.description: This option is useful if the file permissions are not important to us, for example when we are on Windows.

git.title: See your settings
git.description: look at your ~/.gitconfig file. Local config will be in your repository's .git/config file.

git.title: Initialize a git repository for existing code
git.description: Initialize the local directory as a Git repository.
